page.title: 09Farming-Sheep Farming
page.content: The farmer at Bagley Farm has{150 {ewes,270 lambs,44 shearlings}and{5 {tups.}At lambing time the farmer prepares a barn and after the birth he puts each ewe,together with her lambs,into separate pens.And if it is cold during the night he puts a special lamp above the lambs to keep them warm.He must be up most of the night keeping an eye on the ewes so that he can assist them when they are{ {lambing,}should they need it.When the lambs are about two weeks old he puts an elastic band on their tail.This makes the lower part whither and fall off.Around May or June the sheep are{ {sheared.}The shearer uses electric shears and it takes him two or three minutes. He earns{50p}per{fleece.}The fleece are sent to a Bradford mill and are worth about{Â£5}each. { }
